newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends up as commercials cover shorts.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends up as commercials cover shorts.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended up as commercials covered short positions, traders said.

"Commercial covered November shorts, Cargill and RBC-DS bought scale down. There was late commercial demand while locals took profits," a trader said. November WCE canola crush profit margins fell to -6.77 Friday from -6.48 Thursday. July Aug spread at $4.
August canola rose $0.40 to $353.70, November up $3.20 to $344.70.
September flax rose $1.50 to $283.50 and November gained $4.30 to $283 as commission houses bought from commercials.
October western barley rose $2.10 to $128.40 on commercial selling, December up $1.60 to $129.50 as RBC-DS bought from commercials. Volume was 500 lots.
December barley spread at $24 to December wheat.

October feed wheat rose $2.20 to $152.70, December rose $1.70 to $153.50 on commission buying and Alberta Wheat Pool was a late buyer of 150 March up $1.50 at $155.80. Volume was 275 lots. Oats did not trade.
Twenty-five feed pea contracts spread from October to December at $1.
(All values in Canadian dollars except oats, feed peas).
